Text: For the choirmaster. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm.
Context: Indicates that Psalm 85 is meant to be sung and is attributed to the sons of Korah.

Text: You showed favor to Your land, O LORD; You restored Jacob from captivity.
Context: Israel reflects on God’s past mercies, expressing gratitude for deliverance.

Text: You forgave the iniquity of Your people and covered all their sin. Selah
Context: Highlighting divine forgiveness and the covering of sin, prompting contemplation.

Text: You set aside all Your wrath; You turned from Your fierce anger.
Context: The psalmist acknowledges a restoration of relationship with God and cessation of His anger.

Text: Restore us again, O God of our salvation, and put away Your displeasure toward us.
Context: A prayer for continued mercy and a complete restoration of God‘s favor.

Text: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger to all generations?
Context: A fearful concern about the duration of God’s anger.

Text: Will You not revive us again, that Your people may rejoice in You?
Context: Expresses hope for revival and the joy that comes with it.

Text: Show us Your loving devotion, O LORD, and grant us Your salvation.
Context: A request for a demonstration of God‘s steadfast love and the granting of salvation.

Text: I will listen to what God the LORD will say; for He promises peace to His people, His saints— but let them not return to folly.
Context: The psalmist is attentive to God’s word, expecting a message of peace but warning against returning to foolish ways.

Text: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him, that His glory may dwell in our land.
Context: Expresses confidence in the proximity of God‘s salvation for the God-fearing and its impact on the land.

Text: Love and faithfulness meet together; righteousness and peace kiss each other.
Context: Poetically describes the harmonious coming together of divine qualities in God’s salvation.

Text: Faithfulness springs forth from the earth, and righteousness looks down from heaven.
Context: Describes a scene where divine faithfulness and righteousness become tangible realities.

Text: The LORD will indeed give what is good, and our land will yield its harvest.
Context: Foresees God‘s blessings resulting in a fruitful land and abundant harvest.

Text: Righteousness goes before Him and prepares the way for His steps.
Context: Speaks of righteousness leading the way for God’s presence, suggesting divine guidance and path-making.
